column3: This was discussed in #8035: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8035#issuecomment-225366630 and there was no clear preference for renaming it.\n

@pstratem The goal was to have this a permanent option and not an option only for the first start of the client. I.e. you set whether you prefer to usehd or not in your conf file. Thus, the client can warn you if the underlying wallet does not comply your preference.\n
@MarcoFalke OK is there an upgrade strategy?\n
Not for 0.13. But I think there are  plans to use `-upgradewallet` or similar to create a HD seed in 0.14.\n

I think we should keep `-usehd=1` for now.
We need to think about ... 
1. if and how we are going to allow HD for already existing wallets
2. How a user could input a seed (xpriv) during hd wallet creation (I guess a config argument `-hdmasterkey=<xpriv>` would not be the best way to do this, adding an RPC call would allow to pass in a master key at the stage where the wallet has already been c
The rationale for keeping the option named as-is has been explained, no need to rename, closing this.\n
